bibl.idno: The Philip S. Hench Walter Reed/Yellow Fever Collection [manuscript] / [collected by] Philip S. Hench ; HEALTHSCI MS-1.

bibl.title: Letter from T. James Ennis to Philip Showalter Hench, September 21, 1951

div1.p: Ennis confirms Hench's room reservation at Havana's Hotel Nacional de Cuba.

div1.head: Letter from T. James Ennis to Philip Showalter Hench, September 21, 1951
div1.opener:
Fr B
Brad Jan 18 Moran
an Havana 19
Tues Feb 5 Havana -
am
sat sun the
Jan 19-27
miami - Wed 6th
Hotel Nacional de Cuba
HAVANA
September 21st, 1951
AIR MAIL
Dr. P.S. Hench,
Mayo Clinic,
Rochester,
Minnesota.
Dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
Thank you for your letter dated September 19th, just
received.

As requested we are reserving two very nice double
rooms, with twin beds and private baths each, for the
arrival of Dr. and Mrs. Howard Gray, Mrs. Hench and
yourself on January 20th to remain until the 27th.

The rate for each double room will be $27.00 daily Eu-
ropean Plan, on the ocean front, and we shall do our
best to have these rooms connecting.

We shall be glad to reserve a nice Cabaña for your oc
cupancy at the rate of $15.00 per day.

In case of a cancellation or change of plans, 48 hours
notice will be greatly appreciated, and looking forward
to the pleasure of welcoming you to the Nacional, we re-
main,
div1.closer:
Very truly yours, HOTEL NACIONAL DE CUBA
T. James Ennis
Manager. TJE/CMS
The Gotham · Hampshire House · The Warwick NEW YORK CITY · The Blackstone CHICAGO
The Warwick PHILADELPHIA · Sunset Tower HOLLYWOOD, CALIF. · Beverly Wilshire BEVERLY HILLS, CALIF.
Hotel Nacional de Cuba HAVANA · Saranac Inn ON UPPER SARANAC LAKE, N.Y. · El Panama PANAMA CITY, R. OF P.
